fs.fibu2.filter
Class StandardFilterComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  fs.fibu2.filter.StandardFilterComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceDependent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class StandardFilterComponent
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements ResourceDependent

This class implements the standard component, which is used by all standard fsfibu2 EntryFilters. It consists of one or two entry fields and three radio buttons, where the entry field number depends on the choice of the radio button. The radio buttons read 'Equality', 'Regular expression', 'Range' (only the last one needs two entry fields). The two entry fields are labelled 'Min:' and 'Max:' and the single entry field according to a constructor parameter. The component also does some basic validation:
- If REGEX is selected, the single entry fields must contain a valid regular expression
- If a format is specified upon creation, each entry field must conform to that format
- If a comparator is specified upon creation, min <= max must be fulfilled according to that comparator (But this only issues a warning, if it is not fulfilled)
Listeners are notified of selection changes in the radio buttons and content changes in the entry fields

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:

Constructor Detail

StandardFilterComponent

public StandardFilterComponent(java.lang.String singleLabelText,
                               FormatValidator entryFormat,
                               java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String> entryComparator,
                               java.lang.String singleContent,
                               java.lang.String minContent,
                               java.lang.String maxContent,
                               StandardFilterComponent.Selection initialSelection)
Creates a standard editor component

Parameters:
singleLabelText - The label text for the single entry field. If null, the empty string is used
entryFormat - The format to which all content must conform. If null, every format is valid
entryComparator - Compares min and max to ensure min <= max. If null, we always have min <= max. The comparator should not throw any exception, if the format of one string is not valid.
singleContent - The initial content of the single entry field. Only to be specified, if the initial selection is not RANGE
minContent - The initial content of the min entry field. Only to be specified, if the initial selection is RANGE
maxContent - The initial content of the max entry field. Only to be specified, if the initial selection is RANGE
initialSelection - The radio button which is initially selected
